snippet: Kenneth Feinberg, a compensation expert, leads a team that determines who the victims are and how much money they should receive.
abstract: Kenneth R Feinberg, leader of victim compensation team for General Motors, has already identified well more than twice as many deaths from defective switch than company did and will likely illuminate many more; by giving Feinberg sole discretion to identify victims and determine payments, GM's effort to avoid lengthy lawsuits could end up costing company far more than courts would have allowed.

byline.contributor: John Schwartz contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Kenneth Feinberg, a compensation expert, leads a team that determines who the victims are and how much money they should receive.

headline.main: Cold Numbers on G.M. Crisis: A Peek Inside
headline.print_headline: Cold Numbers on G.M. Crisis: A Peek Inside
